name: GAD-7 Anxiety Assessment
description: 7-item self-report questionnaire to screen for and assess severity of generalized anxiety disorder
patientFriendlyDescription: Help us understand how anxiety may be affecting your daily life

questions.label: Feeling Nervous or Anxious
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you felt nervous, anxious, or on edge?

questions.label: Uncontrollable Worrying
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you not been able to stop or control worrying?

questions.label: Excessive Worrying
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you worried too much about different things?

questions.label: Trouble Relaxing
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble relaxing?

questions.label: Restlessness
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been so restless that it's hard to sit still?

questions.label: Irritability
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you become easily annoyed or irritable?

questions.label: Fear of Something Bad Happening
questions.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you felt afraid that something awful might happen?

riskCategories.name: Minimal Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Minimal anxiety symptoms - No clinically significant anxiety disorder

riskCategories.name: Mild Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Mild anxiety symptoms - May indicate mild GAD or adjustment disorder

riskCategories.name: Moderate Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Moderate anxiety symptoms - Likely indicates GAD or other anxiety disorder

riskCategories.name: Severe Anxiety
riskCategories.description: Severe anxiety symptoms - Strong indication of GAD requiring immediate attention

metadata.clinicalUse: Screening and severity assessment for generalized anxiety disorder; monitoring treatment response
